Then Eliphaz<S>464</S> the Temanite<S>8489</S> answered<S>6030</S> and said<S>559</S>,
Can a man<S>1397</S> be profitable<S>5532</S> unto God<S>410</S>, as<S>3588</S> he that is wise<S>7919</S> may be profitable<S>5532</S> unto himself? <sup>as he: or, if he may be profitable, doth his good success depend thereon?</sup>
Is it any pleasure<S>2656</S> to the Almighty<S>7706</S>, that thou art righteous<S>6663</S>? or is it gain<S>1215</S> to him, that thou makest thy ways<S>1870</S> perfect<S>8552</S>?
Will he reprove<S>3198</S> thee for fear<S>3374</S> of thee? will he enter<S>935</S> with thee into judgment<S>4941</S>?
Is not thy wickedness<S>7451</S> great<S>7227</S>? and thine iniquities<S>5771</S> infinite<S>7093</S>?
For thou hast taken a pledge<S>2254</S> from thy brother<S>251</S> for nought<S>2600</S>, and stripped<S>6584</S> the naked<S>6174</S> of their clothing<S>899</S>. <sup>the naked: Heb. the clothes of the naked</sup>
Thou hast not given water<S>4325</S> to the weary<S>5889</S> to drink<S>8248</S>, and thou hast withholden<S>4513</S> bread<S>3899</S> from the hungry<S>7457</S>.
But as for the mighty<S>2220</S> man<S>376</S>, he had the earth<S>776</S>; and the honourable man<S>5375</S> <S>6440</S> dwelt<S>3427</S> in it. <sup>mighty: Heb. man of arm</sup> <sup>honourable: Heb. eminent, or, accepted for countenance</sup>
Thou hast sent<S>7971</S> widows<S>490</S> away empty<S>7387</S>, and the arms<S>2220</S> of the fatherless<S>3490</S> have been broken<S>1792</S>.
Therefore snares<S>6341</S> are round about<S>5439</S> thee, and sudden<S>6597</S> fear<S>6343</S> troubleth<S>926</S> thee;
Or darkness<S>2822</S>, that thou canst not see<S>7200</S>; and abundance<S>8229</S> of waters<S>4325</S> cover<S>3680</S> thee.
Is not God<S>433</S> in the height<S>1363</S> of heaven<S>8064</S>? and behold<S>7200</S> the height<S>7218</S> of the stars<S>3556</S>, how high<S>7311</S> they are! <sup>height of the stars: Heb. head of the stars</sup>
And thou sayest<S>559</S>, How doth God<S>410</S> know<S>3045</S>? can he judge<S>8199</S> through the dark cloud<S>6205</S>? <sup>How: or, What</sup>
Thick clouds<S>5645</S> are a covering<S>5643</S> to him, that he seeth<S>7200</S> not; and he walketh<S>1980</S> in the circuit<S>2329</S> of heaven<S>8064</S>.
Hast thou marked<S>8104</S> the old<S>5769</S> way<S>734</S> which wicked<S>205</S> men<S>4962</S> have trodden<S>1869</S>?
Which were cut down<S>7059</S> out of time<S>6256</S>, whose foundation<S>3247</S> was overflown<S>3332</S> with a flood<S>5104</S>: <sup>whose: Heb. a flood was poured upon their foundation</sup>
Which said<S>559</S> unto God<S>410</S>, Depart<S>5493</S> from us: and what can the Almighty<S>7706</S> do<S>6466</S> for them? <sup>for: or, to</sup>
Yet he filled<S>4390</S> their houses<S>1004</S> with good<S>2896</S> things: but the counsel<S>6098</S> of the wicked<S>7563</S> is far<S>7368</S> from me.
The righteous<S>6662</S> see<S>7200</S> it, and are glad<S>8055</S>: and the innocent<S>5355</S> laugh them to scorn<S>3932</S>.
Whereas<S>518</S> our substance<S>7009</S> is not cut down<S>3582</S>, but the remnant<S>3499</S> of them the fire<S>784</S> consumeth<S>398</S>. <sup>substance: or, estate</sup> <sup>the remnant: or, their excellency</sup>
Acquaint<S>5532</S> now thyself with him, and be at peace<S>7999</S>: thereby good<S>2896</S> shall come<S>935</S> unto thee. <sup>him: that is, God</sup>
Receive<S>3947</S>, I pray thee, the law<S>8451</S> from his mouth<S>6310</S>, and lay up<S>7760</S> his words<S>561</S> in thine heart<S>3824</S>.
If thou return<S>7725</S> to the Almighty<S>7706</S>, thou shalt be built up<S>1129</S>, thou shalt put away<S>7368</S> iniquity<S>5766</S> far<S>7368</S> from thy tabernacles<S>168</S>.
Then shalt thou lay up<S>7896</S> gold<S>1220</S> as<S>5921</S> dust<S>6083</S>, and the gold of Ophir<S>211</S> as the stones<S>6697</S> of the brooks<S>5158</S>. <sup>as dust: or, on the dust</sup>
Yea, the Almighty<S>7706</S> shall be thy defence<S>1220</S>, and thou shalt have plenty<S>8443</S> of silver<S>3701</S>. <sup>defence: or, gold</sup> <sup>plenty: Heb. silver of strength</sup>
For then shalt thou have thy delight<S>6026</S> in the Almighty<S>7706</S>, and shalt lift up<S>5375</S> thy face<S>6440</S> unto God<S>433</S>.
Thou shalt make thy prayer<S>6279</S> unto him, and he shall hear<S>8085</S> thee, and thou shalt pay<S>7999</S> thy vows<S>5088</S>.
Thou shalt also decree<S>1504</S> a thing<S>562</S>, and it shall be established<S>6965</S> unto thee: and the light<S>216</S> shall shine<S>5050</S> upon thy ways<S>1870</S>.
When men are cast down<S>8213</S>, then thou shalt say<S>559</S>, There is lifting up<S>1466</S>; and he shall save<S>3467</S> the humble<S>7807</S> person<S>5869</S>. <sup>the humble: Heb. him that hath low eyes</sup>
He shall deliver<S>4422</S> the island<S>336</S> of the innocent<S>5355</S>: and it is delivered<S>4422</S> by the pureness<S>1252</S> of thine hands<S>3709</S>. <sup>He shall: or, The innocent shall deliver the island</sup>
